content:
Shift Scheduling Considerations and Limits

Required Editions
- Workforce Engagement is available in Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions
- Shift Scheduling is available in the Contact Center SKU, Einstein 1 Service Edition, and Service Suites

For Shift Scheduling, assign Shift Scheduling Planner and Shift Scheduling Agent permission set licenses.
For Workforce Engagement, assign Workforce Engagement Analyst, Workforce Engagement Planner, and Workforce Engagement Agent permission set licenses.

To map job profiles to Omni-Channel queues, Workforce Engagement planners use the Workforce Engagement Configuration app in Setup.
The Match Queue scheduling rule is available only in Workforce Engagement with an Omni-Channel queue-based routing workflow. If using Shift Scheduling or a different workflow, create a Match Skills scheduling rule.

In Workforce Engagement, you can create a capacity plan based on historical workloads and use shift templates to create shifts in bulk.
Shift Scheduling doesnâ€™t include capacity planning.

General Limits
- Maximum service resources per user: 1 per service resource type
- Maximum service resource preferences: 1 per service resource

Maximum records for various objects:
- Shifts, shift templates, etc.: 2000 (can be viewed without searching)
- Time slots, territory members, time sheet entries: platform behavior

Scheduling Limits
- Maximum shift segment types: 200 records
- Maximum shift segments: 10 per shift
- Maximum batch assigned shifts: 200 at once
- Maximum Mass Shift Update shifts: within a 90-day timespan (less than 50,000 recommended)
- Maximum scheduling rules: 50
- Maximum scheduling constraints: 50

Maximum records per page in Shift Manager views:
- View Shifts: up to 2000 records
- Other views: up to 2000 records per page
title: Shift Scheduling Considerations and Limits
